content: Investments General Asked by AnonymousAsked on 27 Jul 2018Do you calculate and include in your CPF while calculating the years to leanfire/fatfire or exclude it?And if you do include cpf, do u include it as total amount for ur entire life (till avg life expectancy with cpf life) or u just calculate in 2 seperate batches. One till 55/65 and then +cpf life payout ontop of your leanfire for 2nd batch? Do you calculate it this way? Really wish to get a couple of ideas off here cause the rate of fire varies with or without cpf.1 answerAnswerBump1
Answers (1)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Lok Yang TengLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 12 Nov 2018Since RE refers to retiring early, CPF monies will still be locked and unusable. I feel years/amount to lean/fat fire shouldnt include CPF.0 comments0
